article_title: Luke Del Rio, former Valor star, to transfer from Oregon State – The Denver Post
article_text:
CORVALLIS, Ore. — Sophomore quarterback Luke Del Rio has decided to leave Oregon State.

Del Rio, the son of Oakland Raiders coach Jack Del Rio, threw for 141 yards last season, appearing in three games as backup to senior starter Sean Mannion. He was considered one of Oregon State’s top options at starter now that Mannion has graduated.

New Beavers coach Gary Andersen, who took over after Mike Riley’s departure for Nebraska in December, said in a statement Thursday that Del Rio decided it was time “to start a new chapter in his life.” Del Rio in turn thanked Oregon State.

Del Rio was a walk-on at Alabama and redshirted in 2013 before transferring to Oregon State for the 2014 season. He played his prep senior season of football at Valor Christian in Highlands Ranch.

og.description: Luke Del Rio, former Valor star, to transfer from Oregon State

article_summary:
CORVALLIS, Ore. — Sophomore quarterback Luke Del Rio has decided to leave Oregon State.
Del Rio was a walk-on at Alabama and redshirted in 2013 before transferring to Oregon State for the 2014 season.
Del Rio, the son of Oakland Raiders coach Jack Del Rio, threw for 141 yards last season, appearing in three games as backup to senior starter Sean Mannion.
He played his prep senior season of football at Valor Christian in Highlands Ranch.
New Beavers coach Gary Andersen, who took over after Mike Riley’s departure for Nebraska in December, said in a statement Thursday that Del Rio decided it was time “to start a new chapter in his life.” Del Rio in turn thanked Oregon State.
